p: Climate is also an important factor for the establishment of any biocontrol agent. Climatic factors can limit the dispersal of biological agents to new areas within the geographic range of the weeds ( Baars 2003). Air temperature is one of the most important factors interfering with the establishment, dispersal, and impact of organisms in new areas of distribution ( Baker 2002). Salbia lotanalis seems to develop better in periods of cooler air temperatures and D. inscita in hotter seasons ( Figures 2A and 4).
